Contexts.Name: Start
Contexts.Description: You wake up to a heavy bouncing sound. You feel very disorganized. Your body is laying on the floor with a very thin mattress under it and you don't quite remember how you got here.

Responses.Text: You're in a sleeping bag on the floor. It's quite dark. You get some light through a window and you can see it shining at a clock which tells the time 02.53. There are two other people in sleeping bags a bit away from you. They are very still. Probably sleeping.
The mattress is very thin. The sort you would use on a hiking trip as a kid. It brings you back to your childhood.
You remember spending a lot of time with your two brothers when you were a kid. You usually did a lot of pranks on your parents.
You have two brothers. Both older than you. You're all old enough to have moved out from home, and live quite far from eachother, but you make sure to sometimes spend some time together.
You see no way of doing that in your current position, you are still on the floor in your sleeping bag.
There seems to be a bouncing sound coming from upstairs. It repeats every 10th second.
You're in a sleeping bag on the floor. You must first get out of it and stand up.
You move your hands above your head in an acrobatic movement and move them outside of the sleeping bag and unzips the zipper.
You have already left the sleeping bag.
You must get out of you sleeping bag before you can stand up.
You rise. Slowly. Trying to not disturb whatever is making that noise.
No way! You feel to exited to go back to sleep... Is that sound what I think it is??
You will never get any hints from me.
Two figures in sleeping bags, highlighted by the moon outside the window. You know them, but your newly awake mind is still a bit lost exactly who they are.
The moon is full. Such a beautiful and majestic rock in the sky.
The window is slightly open to let some cold air in. Its a warm summer night. You feel sweaty inside your sleeping bag.
You are inside the sleeping bag. Its just a normal sleeing bag.
The sleeping bag is in a pile next to you. Good riddance. It was too hot in there.
There is nothing special about the zipper of the sleeping bag.
The clock is at the same time 02.53, but also counting down in time to the beat. What's going on here?
It's much better on the wall then in your pocket.
You close them temporarily. But awake again to the next beat.
That would indeed be silly. Wouldn't it? What's that giant rock in your pocket, some people might ask. Ha- Ha- You would answer. Oh such a splendid joke that would have been.
You are already awake.
Screw you, silly player man. I'm closing this game down on you if you don't stop this.

SideEffects.ParameterName: And a quite good one as well. If I say so myself (Please rate 5 of 5 for humour).

Responses.Text: Why are you like this? Why would you say this to a game? I am just a game you know. Made for Ludum Dare 51 in under 48 hours.
I warn you. One more and I WILL close this game down.
Alright. That is it. Face the consequences.
You want help? How about trying to stand up?
You can't go anywhere. You must first stand up.
You must first stand up before you can go anywhere.
You are laying on the floor. You should probably first stand up before trying to go anywhere.
You sit up in your sleeping bag.
You sit up next to your sleeping bag.

Contexts.Name: Standing
Contexts.Description: Standing up, it feels like your head is suddenly more clear. You came to this house with your two brothers. They are currently laying on the floor a bit away from you. This house your in was advertised as a haunted house. However. You've yet to see anything. Until now. Did that bouncing sound just increase?

Responses.Text: You didn't just stand up just to go back to sleep!
You are already awake.
You go closer to the window and look out to the starlit sky. The stars are truely beautiful tonight. You also see a midsummer pole outside in the yard.
You walk closer toward your brothers. As you hear them snooring, you draw a sigh of relief. They are only sleeping.
You think you could stand here and admire the stars the entire night. If not for the strange sound coming from upstairs.
You open the door. As quietly as possible and then start sneaking. Slowly. Step by step. Upstairs.
It was quite a bit of time ago since it was midsummer. The pole outside is old and hangs to one side. You bet the owners left it there to give the house and its surrounding a more haunted feeling.
Your brothers are laying on the floor next to a slightly open window. The pale moon light shines in on their still faces. The loud bouncing sound continues.
The window is to small to fit you. Also. Do you really want to escape?
Strange. There does not seem to be any door leading to the outside. There is only the door leading upstairs. Toward that mesmerizing repeating sound.
This is very strange. You remember coming here through an outside door. But now, there is only a door leading upstairs.
You open the door leading upstairs. The sound continues.
That would be a bad idea. Closing the window would make this room hot as hell.
The window is already slightly open. Opening it more would only create noise. You don't want to disturb your brothers precious sleep.
You don't want to inflict any violence upon them! You don't even want to wake them. If there is something here, you fear their presence would only scare the something away.
You don't want to wake them. Them being awake may scare away whatever is making that sound.
No. That would wake up your brothers AND scare away whatever is making that sound upstairs.
It's your old sweaty sleeping bag. Its warm as heck.
You stand next to your sleeping bag.
You don't want to go back to sleep. You want to go and check out where that sound is coming from.
Both of them are heavier then what your thin arms can carry.
There is no reason to steal the clock. It's just a bit crazy.
The clock is almost 03 in the night. You just want to go and see what is happening upstairs. After that you should really get back to bed.
There is nothing special about the floor. It's old and creaky. As it usually is in these kinds of houses.

Contexts.Name: Upstairs
Contexts.Description: The door opens by itself. You stand in shock. Unable to move any part of your body. You see something resembling a figure slowly moving toward you.
